title: Satan
comment: The one who opposes the person and purposes of God. Satan is especially associated with deceit, temptation and testing, through which he attempts to deflect believers from obeying God.

children.title: Satan, as the enemy of God
children.comment: Scripture provides numerous examples of ways in which Satan opposes the presence and purposes of God in his world.

children.title: Satan tests believers and causes their suffering
Satan opposes the work of the archangel Michael

seealsos.comment: the parable of the weeds and its explanation
Elymas, the sorcerer, acts on Satan's behalf to oppose Barnabas and Paul.

children.title: Satan's opposition to God's work will not succeed
Satan's role as adversary earns him varied titles
The devil
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he deceives:

children.title: Belial
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he is the troublemaker or scoundrel (the same Hebrew word is used in the OT passages as in 2Co 6:15 to describe Satan's work):

children.title: The dragon
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he is the enemy:

children.title: The serpent
children.precomment: He is the adversary because he thwarts spiritual insight:

children.title: The prince of this world
children.precomment: He is the adversary because his rule is temporary, not absolute:

secondaryrefs.comment: He is the adversary because he is the destroyer.

children.title: Satan, as tempter
children.comment: God's people are incited to evil by Satan. He seeks to exploit their weaknesses in order to deflect them from obedience to God.

children.title: Satan incites God's people to evil

primaryrefs.comment: Rev 12:9 identifies the serpent with Satan.

children.title: He tempts Christians to fall away
He inspires people to put God to the test
Jesus Christ is tempted by Satan
By Jesus Christ's service as high priest
Satan, as deceiver
children.comment: Satan's character is deceitful, devious and cunning as in a variety of guises he seeks to influence people for his own ends.

primaryrefs.comment: Eve was deceived by Satan the serpent.

children.title: Satan, kingdom of
children.comment: Satan is depicted as the prince of this world, having power over demons and over godless people. He is, however, subject to God's sovereignty and therefore his power is limited and his rule temporary.

children.title: He has power in the world
He claims power over this world
He is called the ``prince'' or the ``god'' of this world
He is responsible for some illnesses

seealsos.comment: Paul's ``thorn in the flesh'' may or may not have been a physical illness.

children.title: He is the prince of demons

primaryrefs.comment: The name Beelzebub is used elsewhere to name the prince of the demons. This name was used also to identify Satan.

children.title: He cannot do more than God allows
Satan, agents of
children.comment: Satan works in this world through people and through those spiritual beings who acknowledge his authority. His agents oppose God's will and purposes.

children.title: Satan's human agents pursue his evil desires

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ speaking of the relationship of some unbelieving Jews to Satan.

children.title: Satan works through people to oppose God's purposes
Examples of people doing Satan's work
Others who lead people away from God
Satan works through his spiritual agents

seealsos.comment: ``angel'' and ``messenger'' are the same word in Greek

children.title: Satan's agents are identified by various images and titles

secondaryrefs.comment: probably representing a demon with influence over the Persian kingdom

children.title: The prostitute or Babylon the Great
Satan, resistance to
children.comment: Jesus Christ resisted Satan in his ministry, and believers are commanded to follow his example in this respect. God assists believers in this struggle.

children.title: God protects his people from Satan
God's protection is to be sought in prayer
Jesus Christ has the victory over Satan
Jesus Christ's defeat of Satan on the cross
Jesus Christ's name is powerful against Satan
Satan, defeat of
children.comment: Though defeated on Jesus Christ's cross, Satan is still active in this world, but his final overthrow by God is certain.

children.title: Satan is defeated by Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ is stronger than Satan
Jesus Christ came to destroy Satan's work
Satan is defeated on the cross
Satan's defeat is foreseen by Jesus Christ
Satan and his agents will be destroyed
Death, the result of Satan's work, will be defeated
